metadata.title: CVE-2022-48630 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: crypto:qcom-rng - fix infinite loop on requests not multiple of WORD_SZ The commitreferenced in the Fixes tag removed the 'break' from the else branch inqcom_rng_read(), causing an infinite loop whenever 'max' is not a multipleof WORD_SZ. This can be reproduced e.g. by running: kcapi-rng -b 67>/dev/null There are many ways to fix this without adding back the 'break',but they all seem more awkward than simply adding it back, so do just that.Tested on a machine with Qualcomm Amberwing processor.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48630` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-14-generic - 6.5.0-14.14~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-14-generic - 6.5.0-14.14~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-14-generic-64k - 6.5.0-14.14~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.5.0-1008.8~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.5.0-1007.7~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-gcp - 6.5.0-1010.10~22.04.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-14-lowlatency - 6.5.0-14.14.1~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-14-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-14.14.1~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1003-oem - 6.5.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1007-starfive - 6.5.0-1007.8~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1013-oracle - 6.5.0-1013.13~22.04.4
No subscription required
